descript.abstract: United States Alternative Fueling Facilities is a point theme representing fueling facilities that offer fuels other than gasoline in the United States.
descript.purpose: The dataset provides users with information about alternative fueling station locations and attributes and can be used for national and regional analysis applications.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.5.1450

citeinfo.origin: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)
citeinfo.title: National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2008

pubinfo.publish: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

attracc.attraccr: Station attributes were obtained from the NREL and were then confirmed via the internet when possible

dataqual.logic:
All point records in this dataset are represented by a single coordinate pair and a unique feature identifier.
BTS quality checks were to cross reference the place dataset with the state dataset, to determine that the spatial data and attribute data were accurate.

procstep.procdesc: The creation of this geospatial data layer was completed by RITA/BTS in March 2008. This Shapefile was built from a combination of database tables and internet research. The coordinates of the fueling stations were derived from the addressed by geo location.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Type of Fuel Offered.

edom.edomvd: An alcohol fuel mixture that typically contains a mixture of up to 85% denatured fuel ethanol and gasoline or other hydrocarbon by volume.
Hythane is a mixture of natural gas and hydrogen, usually 5-7 percent hydrogen by energy.

attr.attrdef: The latitude of the point expressed as a signed real number. This value is in decimal degrees with negative values indicating South latitude and positive values indicating North latitude.
The longitude of the point expressed as a signed real number. This value is in decimal degrees with negative values indicating West longitude and positive values indicating East longitude.
The blend of the fuel type if the fuel is blended.

attrdomv.udom: The blend of the fuel type if the fuel is blended.

attr.attrdef: The URLs used to verify the addresses of the Hydrogen fueling stations.

attrdomv.udom: The URLs used to verify the addresses of the Hydrogen fueling stations.

attr.attrdef: Status of the Facility

edom.edomvd: Stations that were operational at the time of publication

onlinopt.accinstr: The NTAD DVD can be ordered from the online bookstore at www.bts.gov. NTAD can also be downloaded from the Geographic Information Program web sit at http://www.bts.gov/programs/geographic_information_services/.

stdorder.ordering: Call (202-366-DATA), or E-mail (answers@bts.gov) RITA/BTS to request the National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2008 DVD. The NTAD cdrom can be ordered from the online bookstore at www.bts.gov. Individual datasets from the NTAD can also be downloaded from the Geographic Information Program web sit at http://www.bts.gov/programs/geographic_information_services/

distinfo.techpreq: Software that can process GIS files.
